texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  i3 window manager  is a fast window manager that helps you keep all of your applications in the right place. It automatically tiles windows and can manage those tiles across multiple virtual desktops.
texts.text: The  i3 window manager  is a fast window manager that helps you keep all of your applications in the right place. It automatically tiles windows and can manage those tiles across multiple virtual desktops.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: However, there are certain applications that I really prefer in a floating window. Floating windows do not get tiled and they can easily be dragged around with your mouse. They're the type of windows you expect to see on other non-tiling desktops such as GNOME or KDE.
texts.text: However, there are certain applications that I really prefer in a floating window. Floating windows do not get tiled and they can easily be dragged around with your mouse. They're the type of windows you expect to see on other non-tiling desktops such as GNOME or KDE.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Convert a window to floating temporarily
texts.text: Convert a window to floating temporarily

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If you have an existing window that you prefer to float, select that window and press  Mod + Shift + Space bar . The window will pop up in front of the tiled windows and you can easily move it with your mouse.
texts.text: If you have an existing window that you prefer to float, select that window and press  Mod + Shift + Space bar . The window will pop up in front of the tiled windows and you can easily move it with your mouse.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Depending on your configuration, you may be able to resize it by grabbing a corner of the window with your mouse. You can also assign a key combination for resizing in your i3 configuration file (usually
texts.text: Depending on your configuration, you may be able to resize it by grabbing a corner of the window with your mouse. You can also assign a key combination for resizing in your i3 configuration file (usually

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# resize window (you can also use the mouse for that)
mode "resize" {
        bindsym Left resize shrink width 10 px or 10 ppt
        bindsym Down resize grow height 10 px or 10 ppt
        bindsym Up resize shrink height 10 px or 10 ppt
        bindsym Right resize grow width 10 px or 10 ppt
        bindsym Return mode "default"
        bindsym Escape mode "default"
        bindsym $mod+r mode "default"
}
bindsym $mod+r mode "resize"
texts.text:
# resize window (you can also use the mouse for that)
mode "resize" {
        bindsym Left resize shrink width 10 px or 10 ppt
        bindsym Down resize grow height 10 px or 10 ppt
        bindsym Up resize shrink height 10 px or 10 ppt
        bindsym Right resize grow width 10 px or 10 ppt
        bindsym Return mode "default"
        bindsym Escape mode "default"
        bindsym $mod+r mode "default"
}
bindsym $mod+r mode "resize"

texts.label: text
texts.orig: With this configuration, simply press  Mod + r  and use the arrow keys to grow or shrink the window's borders.
texts.text: With this configuration, simply press  Mod + r  and use the arrow keys to grow or shrink the window's borders.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: For those windows that you always want to be floating no matter what, i3 has a solution for that, too. Just tell i3 how to identify your windows and ensure
texts.text: For those windows that you always want to be floating no matter what, i3 has a solution for that, too. Just tell i3 how to identify your windows and ensure

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
for_window [window_role="About"] floating enable
for_window [class="vlc"] floating enable
for_window [title="Authy"] floating enable
texts.text:
for_window [window_role="About"] floating enable
for_window [class="vlc"] floating enable
for_window [title="Authy"] floating enable

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In the example above, I have a few windows always set to be floating:
texts.text: In the example above, I have a few windows always set to be floating:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Any time these windows are spawned, they will automatically appear as floating windows. You can always switch them back to tiled manually by pressing  Mod + Shift + Space bar .
texts.text: Any time these windows are spawned, they will automatically appear as floating windows. You can always switch them back to tiled manually by pressing  Mod + Shift + Space bar .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Identifying windows in the way that i3 cares about can be challenging. Knowing when to use

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If I wanted to float all terminator windows, I could add this to my i3 configuration file:
texts.text: If I wanted to float all terminator windows, I could add this to my i3 configuration file:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Do you need a window to always float on a specific workspace? i3 can do that, too!
texts.text: Do you need a window to always float on a specific workspace? i3 can do that, too!

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Let's go back to the example with VLC. Let's consider that we have a really nice 4K display where we always want to watch movies and that's where workspace 2 lives. We can tell i3 to always float the VLC window on workspace 2 with this configuration:
texts.text: Let's go back to the example with VLC. Let's consider that we have a really nice 4K display where we always want to watch movies and that's where workspace 2 lives. We can tell i3 to always float the VLC window on workspace 2 with this configuration:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
set $ws1 "1: main"
set $ws2 "2: 4kdisplay"
for_window [class="vlc"] floating enable
for_window [class="vlc"] move to workspace $ws2
texts.text:
set $ws1 "1: main"
set $ws2 "2: 4kdisplay"
for_window [class="vlc"] floating enable
for_window [class="vlc"] move to workspace $ws2

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Restart i3 to pick up the new changes (usually  Mod + Shift + R ) and start VLC. It should appear on workspace 2 as a floating window!
texts.text: Restart i3 to pick up the new changes (usually  Mod + Shift + R ) and start VLC. It should appear on workspace 2 as a floating window!
